intro: Oreocharis wumengensis, commonly known as the Wumeng lily, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments at elevations between 2,000 and 3,500 meters. Its bulbs are an essential part of its reproductive cycle, and it has a limited geographic distribution, making it vulnerable to habitat loss. Due to its unique botanical features and ecological significance, Oreocharis wumengensis is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
